devdoc.details: Provides:      - `pay2`: specialized method for exactly 2 recipients      - `payMany`: generic method for 1..6 recipients            The contract is stateless, permissionless, and does not hold funds.

params.amount: The amount that was attempted to transfer.
params.to: The address that failed to receive.

params.amount: The amount transferred to the recipient.
params.payer: The address that initiated the payment.

params.a1: Amount to send to first recipient.
params.a2: Amount to send to second recipient.

params.amounts: Array of amounts corresponding to each recipient.

devdoc.title: NativeSplitPayments

InvalidAmount().notice: Thrown when any payout amount is 0.

InvalidLength().notice: Thrown when payMany length is 0 or > 6.

InvalidTotal().notice: Thrown when sum of amounts does not equal msg.value.

SelfAddress().notice: Thrown when any recipient is address(this).

TransferFailed(address,uint256).notice: Thrown when a native transfer via call fails.

ZeroAddress().notice: Thrown when any recipient is address(0).

payMany(address[],uint256[]).notice: Splits msg.value into N exact payouts (N = 1..6).

userdoc.notice: Minimal EVM smart-contract that allows any user to atomically split          a native currency payment (ETH/MATIC/etc) to multiple recipients in a single transaction.
